thread.section_title: Sports - The Daily Republican - Marion, IL
thread.title: Marion spikers sweep Johnston City

author: Justin Walker
title: Marion spikers sweep Johnston City
text: Marion spikers sweep Johnston City Moved into the Health Education Center by the homecoming decorators didn't distract the Marion High School volleyball team too much Thursday night Comment   By Justin Walker Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 4:22 AM By Justin Walker Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 4:22 AM MARION â€” Moved into the Health Education Center by the homecoming decorators didn't distract the Marion High School volleyball team too much Thursday night. Marion swept past Johnston City 25-19, 25-19 in a non-conference match. Madison Onstott had 11 assists and Randi Smith had nine kills and two blocks. Abby Bayer had five kills and Halli Lincoln had four, while Brook Hamilton tacked on three, including the clinching point in the first game. Kylie Plant had four kills and six aces, mostly during a stretch in the second game as Marion pulled away. Kaylee Evans had six assists and Morgan Dodd led the way in digs and also served an ace for the final point. Marion's JV also won 25-16, 25-10 with Evans serving four aces and collecting 13 assists. Lindsay Culbreth had six aces and Haley Van Horn had 25 digs. Amelia Stotlar had six assists, with Kenady Lober notching six kills. Marion's freshmen also won 22-25, 25-10, 15-11 led by McKenzie Orange's seven kills. Next up is the Marion Invitational, which will be held Monday at Cuss Wilson Gymnasium. By Justin Walker   By Justin Walker
